Package model

Class SudokuGame

java.lang.Object
model.OurObservable
model.SudokuGame
public class SudokuGame extends OurObservable
The main state of the current game of Slaydoku. Some functionality include creating a valid Slaydoku board and removing random values, setting the difficulty of a Slaydoku game, and setting the timer when a new Slaydoku game is created. Whenever the Slaydoku game is changed, such as creating a new game, the view is changed.
Author:
Josh Samadder, Jenny Yu, Ricky Su, Chang Chia En

  • Constructor Details

  • Method Details

    • changeDifficulty

      public void changeDifficulty(int difficulty)
      Changes the difficulty of the Slaydoku game. Whenever the difficulty is changed, we start a new Slaydoku game and the view is updated.
      Parameters:
      difficulty - - A number that represents the number of values to remove from the Slaydoku game. The more values removed, the harder the game.

    • clearChanges

      public void clearChanges()
      Clears from the current Slaydoku game any user changes and shows it on the view

    • getCurrentDifficulty

      public int getCurrentDifficulty()
      Retrieves the current difficulty of the Slaydoku game.
      Returns:
      missing - The number of values removed from the current Slaydoku game.

    • solveBoard

      public void solveBoard()
      Solves the board by setting the board of the current game to the board of the solved game. The solved board is displayed in the view. This is done when the user could not solve the board and gave up

    • setDidGiveUp

      public void setDidGiveUp(boolean giveUp)
      Changes the value of didGiveUp to keep track of if the player gave up or not
      Parameters:
      giveUp - - True if the user gave up and False otherwise

    • getDidGiveUp

      public boolean getDidGiveUp()
      Retrieves the value of didGiveUp, which is True if the user gave up
      Returns:
      didGiveUp - True if the user gave up, False otherwise

    • setHasWon

      public void setHasWon(boolean won)
      Changes the value of hasWon to keep track of if the player won or not
      Parameters:
      won - - True if the user won the Slaydoku game, False otherwise

    • getHasWon

      public boolean getHasWon()
      Retrieves the value of hasWon, which is true if the user has won
      Returns:
      hasWon - True if the user won the Slaydoku game, False otherwise

    • getSolvedBoard

      public int[][] getSolvedBoard()
      Retrieves the solved Slaydoku board
      Returns:
      solvedBoard - An integer array that has all values of the Slaydoku board filled out

    • startNewGame

      public void startNewGame(int N, int K)
      This starts a new Slaydoku game. Fills the Slaydoku board and starts a new timer. The new game is then displayed to the user.
      Parameters:
      N - - The number of rows and columns of the Slaydoku game
      K - - The current difficulty of the Slaydoku game

    • getTimer

      public Timer getTimer()
      Retrieves the timer object of the current game
      Returns:
      timer - The timer object that keeps track of how long the user takes for the Slaydoku game

    • getBoard

      public int[][] getBoard()
      Retrieves the Slaydoku board of a new game without any changes
      Returns:
      board - The initial Slaydoku game shown to the user when a new game is created

    • isLoggedIn

      public void isLoggedIn()
      If the user is logged in, then we set the boolean loggedIn to true

    • getLoggedIn

      public boolean getLoggedIn()
      Retrieves the value of loggedIn, which is true if the user is logged in
      Returns:
      loggedIn - True if the user is logged in, False otherwise

    • printSudoku

      public void printSudoku()
      Prints out a text version of the Slaydoku board
